alert.note: Alert for Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 26 at 4:34PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Jones County through 515 PM CDT... At 434 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Center Junction, or 7 miles east of Anamosa. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of central Jones County, including the following locations... Pictured Rocks Wildlife Area, Camp Courageous, Scotch Grove and Central Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
